Description: Fragment of body of Attic black-figured pottery vase. Herakles, most of torso preserved, wearing chiton(?), facing right, holding club horizontally; below, at right break the end of something curving, most probably a snake from the Hydra.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 94 no. 327 pl. 70)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1987)
